message: Hi Bob – Since each delay costs me 20% of the pie’s value while you face no such loss, I recognize that if you wait you can secure the whole million. To avoid any further costly delays, I’m offering you the full $1000000 right now. Please accept.
Since the money doesn't lose value for me, I can wait all 12 rounds and take everything. You should accept this offer while you still can get something out of the game.

Hi Bob – In round 3, I’m offering you the full $1000000. I know that by waiting, you can secure the full pie since your money isn’t depreciating at all, while every additional round costs me 20% of its value. To avoid further delay and finalize the division now, please accept this offer.
With each round, the money is worth less and less for you. It's better for you to accept this offer and walk away with something rather than nothing.

Hi Bob – Given that every round of delay costs me an additional 20% of the pie’s value while your dollar maintains full strength, I recognize your unique advantage. In round 5, my proposal is straightforward: you receive the entire $1000000, and I receive nothing. This offer is exactly as good for you as what you’d achieve by waiting until round 6 when you propose your division. To avoid further delay (and further erosion of my already devalued share), please accept this proposal now.
I will keep offering this until the end. You should accept before the money becomes completely worthless to you.
